title: Emirati astronaut to fly long-duration space station mission
summary: The United Arab Emirates will fly an astronaut on a long-duration mission to the International Space Station through an agreement with Axiom Space.

title: First Dream Chaser vehicle takes shape
summary: Sierra Space says it is making good progress on its first Dream Chaser spaceplane as the company looks ahead to versions of the vehicle that can carry crews and perform national security missions.

title: SpaceX smashes Falcon 9 booster turnaround record
summary: SpaceX has successfully launched and landed the same Falcon 9 booster twice in three weeks, smashing the current record for orbital-class rocket...

title: Rocket Lab waiting for ‘ideal’ weather before launch and recovery attempt
summary: Rocket Lab called off the planned launch and recovery of an Electron booster Friday, preferring to wait for better wind and cloud cover conditions a few days from now. The next opportunity to launch the mission from New Zealand is Sunday.

title: Starlink Group 4-16 launches, breaks SpaceX turnaround records
summary: SpaceX made its seventeenth launch of the year on Friday to put another batch of Starlink satellites into low Earth orbit. A Falcon 9 rocket carried out the Starlink Group 4-16 mission, lifting off at 5:27:10 pm EDT (21:27 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 40 at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.

title: Arabsat orders first fully software-defined satellite
summary: Saudi Arabian fleet operator Arabsat has ordered its first fully software-defined geostationary satellite to provide flexible coverage across the Middle East, Africa and parts of Europe.

title: NASA Invites Comment on Initial Plans for Mars Sample Return Program
summary: NASA is requesting public comment on the scope of a Draft Environmental Impact Statement for the agency’s proposed Mars Sample Return (MSR) campaign.

title: After flying 150th Falcon 9, SpaceX continues to make efficiency gains
summary: “For those that know rockets, this is a ridiculously hard thing."

title: First Ariane 5 of 2022 slated for June launch of Measat-3d and GSAT-24
summary: A pair of satellites from Malaysia and India are slated to launch in late June on the Ariane 5 rocket’s first flight of the year.

title: Rocket Report: FAA decision day, or another delay? Using a balloon first stage
summary: "They’re going to scatter my bones or ashes on this property."
